greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest power of squarefree kernel of n (= A007947) which divides n. It is a first power if and only if n is not a powerful number (A001694, A052485).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: n = 1800: squarefree kernel is 2*3*5 = 30 and a(1800) = 900 = 30^2 divides n, exponent of 30 is the smallest prime exponent of 1800 = 2*2*2*3*3*5*5.
mathematica: {1}~Join~Table[#^IntegerExponent[n, #] &@ Last@ Select[Divisors@ n, SquareFreeQ], {n, 2, 73}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 02 2017 *)
program: a062759 n = a007947 n ^ a051904 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 15 2012
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 16 2001
